results.title: Grain structure
results.creator_credit: Robin Cantelon, Frank A. Hoare and Merton Park
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Structure and Properties of Steel”.
Explains how grain structure and grain size in steel are affected by its carbon content the way in which it is worked and its heat treatment. Indicates also how properties of hardness, ductility and tensile strength are due to differences in its internal structure.

results.title: Strokes
results.brief_description: Diagrams of the human body and the brain depict the causes of disease of the nerves which cause strokes. Explains how strokes may affect speech and memory and result in paralysis of the body or temporary weakness of the muscles. Rehabilitation training and natural replacement in damaged brain cell areas provide reassurance of possible recovery from strokes.

results.title: Strip mine trip
results.creator_credit: Ben Shedd, Robert Churchill and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: This simple film consists of a helicopter shot showing the results of strip mining with voice-overs from local mining people for and against this system of mining explaining the economical advantages versus the aesthetic and ecological disasters of it. An old man comments on all the changes that have taken place in his lifetime and mourns that strip mining is likely to be the worst.

results.title: Stress: parents with a handicapped child
results.creator_credit: Bernice Rubens and Derrick Knight and Partners
results.brief_description: Illustrates the difficulties created for parents by mental and physical defects of children. Five children handicapped in different ways are shown in their family situations and their parents discuss their problems.

results.title: Stress
results.creator_credit: Ian MacNeill, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Dr. Hans Selye’s research and writings on the subject of stress are world-renowned. In this early documentary study, he is interviewed in his laboratories at the Universite de Montreal, where he explains his discoveries. Stress, the general strain on the body caused by disease, injury or mental pressure, is explained and we are shown some of the experiments that led Dr. Selye to his discovery.

results.title: Strega Nonna
results.creator_credit: Gene Deitch and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Animated version of a traditional Calabrian tale, retold and illustrated by Tomi de Paola about Strega Nonna the Italian Grandmother witch who cures headaches, secures husbands and banishes warts. Among her magic secrets is the trick of summoning pasta from her enchanted pot. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: The Stratford adventure
results.creator_credit: Morten Parker, Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: How a small Canadian city, bearing the name of Stratford and by a river Avon, realized the vision of one of its sons: the creation of a theatre for the staging of the finest Shakespearean drama. The film tells how the idea grew, how a famous British director, Tyrone Guthrie, internationally known stars, Alec Guiness and Irene Worth, and Canadian talent were recruited, and how the Stratford Shakespearean Festival finally became a triumphant reality. (Awards: eight, including Edinburgh; Johannesburg; Oscar nomination, Hollywood)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Morten Parker, Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Stowaway. Part 2. Galley sanitation
results.brief_description: Illustrates precautions and sanitarymeasures which should be observed by all food service organisations. Points out that only these measure ensure safety for people served by them.

results.title: Stowaway. Part 3. Food storage
results.brief_description: Covers the inspection of food by the U.S. Army Veterinary Corps, the Bureau of Animal Industry and the Port Food Service Inspector prior to procurement for use aboard troop transports. Shows in detail the principles and proper facilities for food storage and preservation.

results.title: Story of Ted Hughes
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The story of the rehabilitation of a youth who lost a leg in an accident as a boy. The services rendered by the Rehabilitation Branch of the Social Services are indicated including physiotherapy, occupational therapy, study and recreation. Problems of employing disabled people are studied with recognition given to the fact that it is ability, not disability, that counts.
